floatingpoint.parameters
Class MidiManager

java.lang.Object
  floatingpoint.toolkit.util.Transmitter
      floatingpoint.parameters.MidiManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
floatingpoint.toolkit.util.IObservable, floatingpoint.toolkit.util.IObserver, floatingpoint.toolkit.util.IReceiver, floatingpoint.toolkit.util.ITransmitter
 class MidiManager
extends floatingpoint.toolkit.util.Transmitter
implements floatingpoint.toolkit.util.IReceiver, floatingpoint.toolkit.util.IObservable, floatingpoint.toolkit.util.IObserver

Handles all the midi input and output processing for a parameter

Author:
floatingpoint

Nested Class Summary
static class MidiManager.MidiInputTypes
          defines the types of Midi message to receive.
static class MidiManager.MidiOutputTypes
          defines the types of Midi message we can output through.

Returns:
the isLearningMidiInput

setLearningMidiInput

public void setLearningMidiInput(boolean isLearningMidiInput)
Parameters:
isLearningMidiInput - setting this to true will tell the midi manager to learn input values from the next received midi message.

transmitMidiMessage

public void transmitMidiMessage(floatingpoint.toolkit.midi.FpdMidiMessageShort midiMessage)
send a midiMessage to the attached receivers.

transmitMidiMessageValue

public void transmitMidiMessageValue(float value,
                                     float min,
                                     float max)
send a midiMessage to the attached receivers that is derived from a given value and the midiOutput settings. Value is scaled to the proper midi value range given min and max. So value should always be between min and max.

Parameters:
value - the value to convert to midi data and transmit.
min - the lower bound on the value.
max - the upper bound on the value.
